snippet: Ninety percent of the George Washington National Forest will be closed to hydraulic fracturing and conventional oil and gas drilling.
abstract: Compromise government plan will allow hydraulic fracturing for natural gas to go forward on privately controlled land in George Washington National Forest, which rises in the mountains west of Charlottesville, Va; 90 percent of forest remains closed to fracking and conventional drilling.
lead_paragraph: Ninety percent of the George Washington National Forest will be closed to hydraulic fracturing and conventional oil and gas drilling.

headline.main: In Compromise Plan, Limited Fracking Is Approved for National Forest in Virginia
headline.print_headline: In Compromise Plan, Limited Fracking Is Approved for National Forest in Virginia

keywords.value: George Washington and Jefferson National Forests
keywords.name: glocations
